AnatomicalEntityDescriptor.description: A descriptor for anatomical locations, bindable to UBERON

description.description: A description of the descriptor. This may typically be redundant with the `term` object, but the description is more human-readable and may be used to communicate nuances not captured by the rigid standardization of the term object.

located_in.description: Anatomical location where this entity/process occurs or procedure is performed

modifier.description: Directional or qualitative modifier for a descriptor (e.g., increased, decreased, abnormal)

preferred_term.description: The preferred human-readable term for this descriptor

qualifiers.description: List of predicate-value pairs for formal post-composition. Allows OWL-like expressivity with controlled predicates (e.g., RO relations) and values.

term.description: Optional UBERON anatomical entity term reference

AnatomicalEntityDescriptor.title: AnatomicalEntityDescriptor

ComputationalModel.description: A computational or in-silico model relevant to understanding disease mechanisms

base_model.description: Parent/base model this is derived from (e.g., Recon3D, Harvey 1.0)

model_format.description: File format (e.g., SBML, MATLAB, JSON, ONNX)

model_id.description: Identifier within the repository (e.g., Recon3D, BIOMD0000000123)

model_software.description: Software/toolbox for running the model (e.g., COBRApy, COBRA Toolbox)

perturbations.description: Gene knockouts, reaction deletions, or parameter changes modeling the disease

repository_url.description: URL to model repository (GitHub, BiGG, VMH, BioModels)

Dataset.description: A reference to a publicly available omics or phenotype dataset

accession.description: Dataset accession identifier as a CURIE (e.g., geo:GSE67472)

conditions.description: Experimental conditions or disease states represented

data_type.description: The type of omics or other data in the dataset

description.description: A description of the dataset. This may typically be redundant with the `title` slot, but the description is more human-readable and may be used to communicate nuances not captured by the rigid standardization of the title slot.

exposures.description: Environmental exposures studied in the dataset

organism.description: The organism from which samples were derived

sample_count.description: Total number of samples in the dataset

sample_types.description: Types of biological samples in the dataset

notes.description: Additional clinical notes or management considerations
